inference:
The altitudes of an equilateral triangle divide the triangle into 6 smaller triangles of equal area.
The shaded regions together form two of the 6 triangles, so the total area of the shaded regions is $\frac{2}{6}$ of the area of the equilateral triangle.
The probability of the spinner landing in a shaded region is $\frac{2}{6} = \frac{1}{3}$.
Final Answer: $\boxed{\frac{1}{3}}$. I hope it is correct.
ground_truth: There are six sections in which the spinner can come to rest, and it is equally likely that it will come to rest in each of the sections. Thus, the probability that it will come to rest in one of the two shaded regions is $\frac{2}{6} = \boxed{\frac{1}{3}}$.
